com.engine.entity

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.coreObject.CoreObject
      • com.engine.entity.Entity
        • com.engine.entity.Player

  • public class Player
extends Entity

    Player

    A player is the main entity that is typically controlled by the user.

    Basic Functionality:

    This base player class allows the same functionality as a basic core object as well as a positional world border. For extended functionality, make a custom player class that extends this one.

    Controls:

    Player controls are not handled in the Player class. To set up player controls create keys in the project's resource class and link actions to keys using a controller class.

    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth

      • Player

        public Player(float xPos,
              float yPos,
              int id,
              java.awt.Image[] images,
              boolean usePhysics,
              AnimationSet ani,
              java.lang.String name)
        Create a new player with an initial position.
        Parameters:
        xPos - - the x position of the player
        yPos - - the y position of the player
        id - - the project id of this player
        image - - the base graphic of the player
        usePhysics - - does the player "fall" because of gravity

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Override of tick() in CoreObject. This method is being overridden because the player should have a boundary in the world. If the player goes too far to the left or right in the world, it will be stopped.
        Overrides:
        tick in class CoreObject
